intro: Vaccinium uliginosum f. depressum, commonly known as the bog blueberry, is a low-growing shrub native to acidic peat bogs and wetlands in northern regions. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. The plant has dense, leathery leaves that help it thrive in waterlogged soils. It plays an important role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing food for wildlife. Its compact growth habit and adaptability to harsh conditions make it a resilient species in its environment.
